sub_topic: Balancing chemical equations for inorganic compounds
message_1: What is the balanced chemical equation for the reaction between iron(III) chloride and potassium hydroxide to produce iron(III) hydroxide and potassium chloride?
message_2:
The balanced chemical equation for the reaction between iron(III) chloride (FeCl3) and potassium hydroxide (KOH) to produce iron(III) hydroxide (Fe(OH)3) and potassium chloride (KCl) is:

FeCl3 + 3KOH â†’ Fe(OH)3 + 3KCl
